result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony D Lipsey

records.addlTxt:
10:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony D Lipsey in court, in custody.  Attorney Toni L. Young in court for Anthony D Lipsey. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF486/22TR4073-22TR4079. Victim rights compliance. Attorney Young is requesting an adjournment for reasons set forth on the record. The State does not object. TR cases continue to trail. Court will schedule to matter for a final pretrial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

01:45 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Anthony D Lipsey, appeared in custody with Attorney Toni L. Young.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF486/22TR4073-22TR4079. Attorney Young advises the Court that she is withdrawing her speedy trial demand as the defense is not prepared to proceed to trial next week for reasons set forth on the record. Court will grant Attorney Young's request to adjourn the jury trial. Discussion held regarding State's concern if there is a second speedy trial demand; Court will not make a decision regarding possibility of second speedy trial demand today. Court holds colloquy with DE regarding withdrawing his speedy trial demand. Court removes jury trial from calendar next week and Attorney Young is requesting a STC be scheduled. Cases 22TR4073-22TR4079 continue to trail 22CF486.  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
filed by ADA Smathers
and Demand for Discovery

08:34 AM  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant, Anthony D Lipsey, appeared in custody with Attorney Toni L. Young.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Young filed a bond motion on 7/11/22 and requests it be heard by the Court today. Arguments heard. Court denies bond motion for reasons set forth on the record. Attorney Young filed a speedy trial demand on 7/19/22. Discussion held regarding the parties availability for jury trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed by Attorney Toni L. Young

Defendant Anthony D Lipsey appeared with Attorney Toni L. Young.  Defendant in custody.  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State..  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  DE motion to modify bond deferred today.  Speedy trial demand made orally.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:47 PM  
  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 7/19/22 @ 930am.   Bond is continued.   Atty requests to hold bond motion in abayance so it may be heard by the Judge.   jk
for Bond Reduction filed by Attorney Toni Young

Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
